com.sk89q.worldguard.protection

Class GlobalRegionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sk89q.worldguard.protection.GlobalRegionManager
  • Deprecated. 
    use WorldGuardPlugin.getRegionContainer()

    @Deprecated
public class GlobalRegionManager
extends Object
    This is the legacy class for accessing region data.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        @Nullable
public RegionManager get(org.bukkit.World world)
        Deprecated. 
        Get the region manager for a world if one exists.

        This method may return null if region data for the given world has not been loaded, has failed to load, or support for regions has been disabled.

        Parameters:
        world - the world
        Returns:
        a region manager, or null if one is not available

      • getLoaded

        public List<RegionManager> getLoaded()
        Deprecated. 
        Get an immutable list of loaded RegionManagers.
        Returns:
        a list of managers

      • canBuild

        @Deprecated
public boolean canBuild(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                    org.bukkit.block.Block block)
        Deprecated. use RegionContainer.createQuery()
        Test whether the player can build (place, use, destroy blocks and entities) at the given position, considering only the build flag and the region's members.

        This method is not an absolute test as to whether WorldGuard would allow or block an event because this method doesn't consider flags (i.e. chest-access flags when concerning a chest) or other modules in WorldGuard (i.e chest protection).

        Parameters:
        player - the player
        block - the block
        Returns:
        true if a bypass is permitted

      • canBuild

        @Deprecated
public boolean canBuild(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                    org.bukkit.Location location)
        Deprecated. use RegionContainer.createQuery()
        Test whether the player can build (place, use, destroy blocks and entities) at the given position, considering only the build flag and the region's members.

        This method is not an absolute test as to whether WorldGuard would allow or block an event because this method doesn't consider flags (i.e. chest-access flags when concerning a chest) or other modules in WorldGuard (i.e chest protection).

        Parameters:
        player - the player
        location - the location
        Returns:
        true if a bypass is permitted
